page.title: 20The Camping Close.
page.content: {The Camping Close}is the village green of Steeple Bumpstead and lies between the Church and Bower Hall Drive. This land used to be owned by{Parsonage {Farm}now known as{The Gun House. }It is thought that the name "Camping Close" derives from the game{"CAMP"}a ball game long popular in East Anglia and first referred to in a deed in {1486.}It was regarded as manly and healthy exercise which was also good for the{pightel or meadow.}The game is similar to rugby but using a small round ball and goals made up from the cast off clothes of players pitched 150 yards apart. A goal is called a {"snotch"}and if a player is caught with the ball he loses a "snotch". A game ends when 7 or 9 "snotches" are scored and can take 2 or 3 hours. The Close has a recently built{Pavilion; {Football and cricket}are now played.
